name: ululation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a long, high cry with the mouth and tongue that changes between two or three notes, often to show emotion at a ceremony such as a wedding or funeral: Even the shrill ululations from the temples seemed oddly comforting. the ululation of Middle Eastern funerals
More examplesFewer examplesTowns were dust, streets were rubble, and all about rang the ululations of grief.After a few moments a strange ululation sounded, a despairing cry.She punctuates her song with quavering wails (properly called ululations) that have a strong spice of North Africa.
